page.title: 17STUDLAND DAIRY FARMING
page.content: The children visited the Manor Farm outside the village. The land,rented from the National Trust,covers 1000 acres.Crops grown are Winter/Spring Barley and potatoes.There are 48 dairy cows and 20 Beef stock.Five workers are employed full time.Farm machinery used includes 3 tractors, bailer, combine harvester and various ploughs but workers claimed the job of farming was harder these days.They complained about EEC regulations,especially the Milk Quota. The milk is sent to Bournemouth for processing and distribution.Other local farms are similar but of smaller acreage.
